news.title: Sleaford Mods announce Dublin, Belfast and Cork shows
The UK, Canada, Australia and Portugal officially recognise the State of Palestine
news.summary: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas said the recognitions will help to pave the way for the "State of Palestine to live side by side with the State of Israel in security, peace and good neighbourliness."

news.title: Student Special: Fashion - "College is the best place to take inspiration from what people are wearing, to experiment – and decide what you like"
news.summary: Áine Gammell takes a look at the latest college fashion trends.

news.title: Doireann Garrihy announces Ireland tour
news.summary: Tickets go on sale on September 26.

news.title: Outkast announce 25th anniversary edition of Stankonia and Rock and Roll Hall Of Fame induction
news.summary: The anniversary record comes out on October 31.

news.title: D4vd cancels Dublin show amid investigation into dead teen found in his car
news.summary: Dublin's 3Olympia Theatre said on its website the show "is cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances."

news.title: DUG: "There’s an appreciation in Ireland for American music  that doesn’t even exist in a  lot of America"
news.summary: As they release their debut album Have At It! via the legendary Claddagh Records label, buskers-turned-festival favourites DUG discuss flogging rocks to fans, identity crises, and American music.

news.title: Discover European Mushrooms: Learn to make Mushroom Duxelles on Sourdough with chef Eric Matthews of Kicky's
news.summary: Follow the recipe for this relatively simple yet phenomenally flavoursome dish – starring European mushrooms – below...

news.title: Curtisy, Ahmed, With Love. and more to perform at Ireland Against Racism Carnival
news.summary: The Carnival march will take place this Saturday, September 27.
